page.title: 16BOMB EFFECTS ON HARLESDEN
page.content: {Land mines and bombs}were explosive devices that were used to blow up the enemy.{The railways in Brent were the {worst hit.}Willesden Junction and Harlesden Station each had an exploded land mine. During the{Second World War}in the area of Park Parade, Rucklidge Avenue, Leghorn Road, Chomonley Avenue and Radcliffe Avenue{5 land mines exploded and 5 were left unexploded. Drayton Road and Harlesden Gardens had two buildings destroyed.We went to Drayton Road and we discovered that houses 107-137 were all fairly new, so we decided that must have been where the bombs fell. We could find no evidence of bomb damage in any of the other streets because there seemed to be a lot of very new houses.The people we interviewed said they were{"too young {to remember".
